title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Kings chapter 11 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Kings Chapter 11.

questions.question: Who destroyed all the royal seed after her son died?
questions.correctAnswer: Athaliah
questions.explanation: Athaliah, the mother of Ahaziah, destroyed all the royal seed after her son died as stated in 2 Kings 11:1.

questions.question: Who hid Joash from Athaliah to protect him?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehosheba
questions.explanation: Jehosheba, daughter of king Joram and sister of Ahaziah, hid Joash to keep him safe from Athaliah as described in 2 Kings 11:2.

questions.question: How long was Joash hidden in the house of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Six years
questions.explanation: Joash was hidden in the house of the LORD for six years according to 2 Kings 11:3.

questions.question: Who made a covenant with the rulers over hundreds to protect Joash?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoiada
questions.explanation: Jehoiada sent for the rulers over hundreds and made a covenant with them to protect Joash as recorded in 2 Kings 11:4.

questions.question: According to Jehoiada's command, what fraction of the men would keep watch at the king's house on the Sabbath?
questions.correctAnswer: One third
questions.explanation: Jehoyada commanded that a third part of the men that enter on the Sabbath should keep watch at the king's house as stated in 2 Kings 11:5.

questions.question: Where were the other two groups stationed besides the king's house on the Sabbath?
options: Gate of Sur and gate behind the guard
questions.correctAnswer: Gate of Sur and gate behind the guard
questions.explanation: One third part were at the gate of Sur and one third part at the gate behind the guard, as described in 2 Kings 11:6.

questions.question: True or False: Jehoiada gave the captains king David's spears and shields from the temple.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jehoiada gave the captains king David's spears and shields from the temple as stated in 2 Kings 11:10.

questions.question: How did the people respond when Joash was crowned king?
options: They clapped their hands and said, 'God save the king'
questions.correctAnswer: They clapped their hands and said, 'God save the king'
questions.explanation: After Joash was crowned, the people clapped their hands and said, 'God save the king' as recorded in 2 Kings 11:12.

questions.question: What was Athaliah's reaction when she heard the noise of the guard and people?
options: She tore her clothes and cried 'Treason, Treason'
questions.correctAnswer: She tore her clothes and cried 'Treason, Treason'
questions.explanation: Athaliah tore her clothes and cried 'Treason, Treason' when she saw the king and the people rejoicing as described in 2 Kings 11:14.

questions.question: True or False: Jehoiada commanded that Athaliah be killed inside the house of the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jehoiada commanded that Athaliah not be slain in the house of the LORD, as noted in 2 Kings 11:15.

questions.question: Where was Athaliah killed?
questions.correctAnswer: Beside the king's house
questions.explanation: Athaliah was slain beside the king's house as stated in 2 Kings 11:20.

questions.question: What covenant did Jehoiada make after Joash was crowned king?
options: Between the LORD, the king, and the people
Between the king and the priests only
Between the people and the foreigners
Between the guards and the captains
questions.correctAnswer: Between the LORD, the king, and the people
questions.explanation: Jehoiada made a covenant between the LORD, the king, and the people as recorded in 2 Kings 11:17.

questions.question: True or False: The people broke down the house of Baal and killed its priest.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: All the people broke down the house of Baal and killed Mattan the priest of Baal as described in 2 Kings 11:18.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Seven years old was ______ when he began to reign.'
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoash
questions.explanation: The verse 2 Kings 11:21 states that Jehoash was seven years old when he began to reign.

questions.question: How were the men armed when they surrounded the king during the coronation?
questions.correctAnswer: With weapons in their hands
questions.explanation: The men surrounded the king with weapons in their hands as commanded in 2 Kings 11:8.

medium.title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Kings Chapter 11 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Jehosheba's action in hiding Joash teach us about faith and obedience during times of danger?
options: She trusted God's protection and obeyed His will to preserve the royal line
She relied on her own strength to defeat Athaliah
She ignored the danger and hoped for the best
She sought help from foreign allies
questions.correctAnswer: She trusted God's protection and obeyed His will to preserve the royal line
questions.explanation: Jehosheba hid Joash to protect him from Athaliah's destruction (2 Kings 11:2-3). This act demonstrates faith in God's plan and obedience to preserve His chosen king.

questions.question: What does the covenant Jehoiada made with the rulers and captains teach us about spiritual leadership and unity in the church?
options: It teaches the importance of covenant, unity, and shared responsibility in protecting God's purposes
It shows that leaders must act independently without consulting others
It suggests that only priests should lead without involving others
It implies that spiritual leaders should avoid making plans with the people
questions.correctAnswer: It teaches the importance of covenant, unity, and shared responsibility in protecting God's purposes
questions.explanation: Jehoiada made a covenant and took an oath with leaders to protect Joash and God's plan (2 Kings 11:4). This shows the value of unity and shared commitment in spiritual leadership.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to neglect spiritual discipline on the Sabbath. How does Jehoiada's instructions about guarding the king on the Sabbath encourage perseverance?
options: They show the importance of steadfastness and vigilance even on sacred days
They suggest resting completely without responsibility
They encourage ignoring duties to focus on personal wants
They imply that Sabbath is not important
questions.correctAnswer: They show the importance of steadfastness and vigilance even on sacred days
questions.explanation: Jehovah’s instructions to keep watch on the Sabbath (2 Kings 11:5-8) emphasize dedication and perseverance in duty even on holy days.

questions.question: How does the people's joyful response to Joash's coronation teach us about gratitude and contentment in God's provision?
options: It shows rejoicing and gratitude when God restores His chosen king
questions.correctAnswer: It shows rejoicing and gratitude when God restores His chosen king
questions.explanation: The people rejoiced and praised God when Joash was crowned (2 Kings 11:12, 14, 20), demonstrating gratitude and contentment with God's providence.

questions.question: What biblical truth can you share from this chapter about dealing with opposition and temptation in leadership?
options: Faithful leaders must rely on God's protection and wise planning to overcome opposition
Leaders should avoid confrontation at all costs
Leaders must use violence without restraint
Opposition should be ignored to avoid conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful leaders must rely on God's protection and wise planning to overcome opposition
questions.explanation: Jehoiada’s strategic and faithful actions to protect Joash and remove Athaliah (2 Kings 11:4-16) show reliance on God and wise leadership amid opposition.

questions.question: How does the destruction of Baal's temple and altars encourage believers toward holiness and loyalty to God?
options: It teaches that believers should reject idolatry and dedicate themselves fully to God
It suggests tolerating all religions equally
It promotes ignoring false worship practices
questions.correctAnswer: It teaches that believers should reject idolatry and dedicate themselves fully to God
questions.explanation: The people destroyed Baal's temple and worship to remain loyal to the LORD (2 Kings 11:18), emphasizing holiness and exclusive devotion.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with discouragement when facing trials. Based on Jehosheba and Jehoiada's actions, what biblical encouragement can you share?
options: Trust in God’s plan and be patient; He can protect and restore
Give up hope and avoid involvement
Take matters into your own hands by force
Ignore the situation and hope it resolves itself
questions.correctAnswer: Trust in God’s plan and be patient; He can protect and restore
questions.explanation: Jehosheba hid Joash and Jehoiada waited for God's timing (2 Kings 11:2-4), showing trust and patience during trials.

questions.question: How does the example of Jehoiada giving David’s spears and shields to the captains teach us about integrity and stewardship in service?
options: Leaders must responsibly equip and empower those serving God
Leaders should hoard resources for themselves
Stewardship is unimportant in spiritual work
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders must responsibly equip and empower those serving God
questions.explanation: Jehoiada distributed weapons to captains (2 Kings 11:10), showing responsible stewardship and enabling faithful service.

questions.question: True or False: Athaliah was killed inside the house of the LORD according to this chapter.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jehoiada commanded that Athaliah not be slain in the house of the LORD, and she was killed outside the temple (2 Kings 11:15-16).

questions.question: True or False: Jehoash began to reign when he was seven years old, demonstrating God’s timing in raising leaders.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The chapter states Jehoash was seven when he began to reign, showing God’s perfect timing in leadership (2 Kings 11:21).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jehoiada made a covenant between the LORD and the king and the people, that they should be the ________ people.
questions.correctAnswer: LORD'S
questions.explanation: Jehoiada established a covenant for the people to be the LORD's people, emphasizing spiritual allegiance (2 Kings 11:17).

questions.question: What lesson about protecting spiritual authority can be drawn from the guards being stationed with weapons around the king?
options: Faithful protection of God's anointed is vital for spiritual order and obedience
Physical protection is unnecessary in spiritual matters
Violence is the first solution to opposition
Leaders should isolate themselves from their followers
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful protection of God's anointed is vital for spiritual order and obedience
questions.explanation: The guards stood ready to protect Joash with weapons (2 Kings 11:8, 11), showing the importance of guarding God's chosen leaders.

questions.question: Based on the chapter, how should the church respond to false worship and idolatry in its midst?
options: By decisively removing and destroying idols and false practices
By ignoring them and hoping they fade away
By blending them with true worship
By tolerating them to keep peace
questions.correctAnswer: By decisively removing and destroying idols and false practices
questions.explanation: The people destroyed Baal's temple and images to restore true worship (2 Kings 11:18), teaching decisive action against idolatry.

questions.question: What practical truth about family protection and godly parenting is illustrated in Jehosheba's care for Joash?
options: Protecting and nurturing children in faith is crucial for God's promises to continue
Children should be left to fend for themselves
Parents should prioritize worldly success over spiritual safety
Family roles are unimportant in God's plan
questions.correctAnswer: Protecting and nurturing children in faith is crucial for God's promises to continue
questions.explanation: Jehosheba hid and cared for Joash, preserving the royal line and God's covenant (2 Kings 11:2-3), highlighting godly parenting.

questions.question: How does the people's participation in crowning Joash teach us about the role of the community in church life?
options: The community's active involvement supports and affirms godly leadership
Leadership should be imposed without community input
The community should remain passive in spiritual matters
Only priests should interact with leaders
questions.correctAnswer: The community's active involvement supports and affirms godly leadership
questions.explanation: The people rejoiced and clapped when Joash was anointed king (2 Kings 11:12,14), showing communal support in church life.

hard.title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Kings Chapter 11.

questions.question: What action did Athaliah take upon learning her son Ahaziah was dead?
options: She destroyed all the royal seed
She sought help from the priests
questions.correctAnswer: She destroyed all the royal seed
questions.explanation: According to 2 Kings 11:1, Athaliah arose and destroyed all the seed royal upon seeing that her son was dead.

questions.question: Who was responsible for hiding Joash, the son of Ahaziah, to protect him from Athaliah?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehosheba, sister of Ahaziah
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 11:2 states that Jehosheba, daughter of King Joram and sister to Ahaziah, took Joash and hid him from Athaliah.

questions.question: For how many years was Joash hidden in the house of the LORD during Athaliah's reign?
questions.correctAnswer: Six years
questions.explanation: Verse 3 specifies that Joash was hidden in the house of the LORD for six years while Athaliah reigned.

questions.question: What significant event took place in the seventh year during Jehoiada's leadership?
options: The house of Baal was rebuilt
questions.correctAnswer: Joash was crowned king
questions.explanation: In 2 Kings 11:4-12, in the seventh year, Jehoiada organized a covenant and crowned Joash king in the house of the LORD.

questions.question: How did Jehoiada arrange the guards to protect the king during the coronation?
options: Divided them into thirds, stationed at the king's house and gates
Placed all guards at the temple entrance
Assigned guards only at the palace gates
questions.correctAnswer: Divided them into thirds, stationed at the king's house and gates
questions.explanation: Verses 5-7 explain Jehoiada's division of the guards into thirds to watch the king's house and gates on the Sabbath.

questions.question: What symbolic items did the priest give to the captains over hundreds?
questions.correctAnswer: King David's spears and shields
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 11:10 states that Jehoiada gave King David's spears and shields, kept in the temple, to the captains over the hundreds.

questions.question: What was Athaliah's reaction upon hearing the noise of the guard and people in the temple?
options: She rent her clothes and cried 'Treason!'
questions.correctAnswer: She rent her clothes and cried 'Treason!'
questions.explanation: According to 2 Kings 11:13-14, Athaliah tore her clothes and shouted treason when she saw the king crowned.

questions.question: What instruction did Jehoiada give regarding Athaliah's execution?
options: To kill her outside the temple and not in the house of the LORD
To imprison her in the temple
To exile her from the city
questions.correctAnswer: To kill her outside the temple and not in the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 15 records Jehoiada's command to kill Athaliah outside the temple to avoid bloodshed in the house of the LORD.

questions.question: What covenant did Jehoiada make after the death of Athaliah?
options: A covenant between the LORD, the king, and the people
A covenant to rebuild the temple
questions.correctAnswer: A covenant between the LORD, the king, and the people
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 11:17 shows Jehoiada establishing a covenant linking the LORD, the king, and the people as the LORD's people.

questions.question: What did the people do to the house of Baal following the covenant?
options: They destroyed the altars and images and killed the priest of Baal
They restored the house of Baal
They dedicated it to the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: They destroyed the altars and images and killed the priest of Baal
questions.explanation: Verse 18 describes the people's destruction of Baal's house and the killing of Mattan the priest of Baal.

questions.question: Which feature of ancient Near Eastern royal legitimacy is emphasized by placing the crown and anointing Joash in the temple?
questions.correctAnswer: Divine sanction of kingship
questions.explanation: The anointing and crowning of Joash in the temple (2 Kings 11:12) exemplify the biblical motif of divine approval legitimizing a king's rule.

questions.question: True or False: The guards were stationed only at the temple gates during Joash’s coronation.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verses 5-7 show the guards were divided into thirds and stationed at various points including the king’s house and multiple gates, not just temple gates.

questions.question: The destruction of Baal's house in 2 Kings 11:18 foreshadows which later biblical event involving Elijah?
options: The crossing of the Red Sea
questions.correctAnswer: The showdown on Mount Carmel
questions.explanation: The destruction of Baal’s house and priest in this chapter prefigures Elijah’s confrontation with Baal prophets on Mount Carmel (1 Kings 18).

questions.question: What literary structure best describes the narrative of Joash’s preservation and coronation in 2 Kings 11?
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm emphasizing preservation and restoration
questions.explanation: The story forms a chiasm with Joash’s hidden preservation (vv. 2-3) paralleling his restoration as king (vv. 12-21), highlighting divine protection.

questions.question: What is the significance of the Hebrew term for 'destroy' (as used in 2 Kings 11:1) in the context of Athaliah’s actions?
options: It denotes complete annihilation of the royal seed
It implies exile but not death
It means to imprison the heirs
questions.correctAnswer: It denotes complete annihilation of the royal seed
questions.explanation: The Hebrew verb used implies total destruction, showing Athaliah’s intent to eliminate all royal heirs, as in 2 Kings 11:1.

theological.title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Kings Chapter 11 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What motivated Athaliah to destroy all the royal seed according to 2 Kings 11?
options: To gain favor with the priests
questions.correctAnswer: Because her son was dead
questions.explanation: Athaliah destroyed all the royal seed because her son Ahaziah was dead, as stated in 2 Kings 11:1. This reflects the human sinfulness and desire for power seen throughout Scripture (e.g., Genesis 4:8; Esther 3:6; Psalm 2:1-4; Matthew 2:16).

questions.question: Who hid Joash from Athaliah to preserve the Davidic line?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehosheba, sister of Ahaziah
questions.explanation: Jehosheba, daughter of King Joram and sister of Ahaziah, took Joash and hid him, preserving the Davidic covenantal promise (2 Kings 11:2). This preservation of the messianic line echoes God’s faithfulness to His covenant (Genesis 12:7; 2 Samuel 7:12-16; Luke 1:32-33; Hebrews 7:14).

questions.question: For how many years was Joash hidden in the house of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Six years
questions.explanation: Joash was hidden in the house of the LORD for six years while Athaliah reigned, demonstrating God's providential protection of His king (2 Kings 11:3). This parallels God's protective care as seen with Moses (Exodus 2:2-10), David (1 Samuel 19:10-18), and Jesus (Matthew 2:13-15).

questions.question: What significant action did Jehoiada take in the seventh year concerning Joash?
options: He revealed Joash to the rulers and made a covenant with them
He fled the city to avoid persecution
He destroyed the temple of Baal
questions.correctAnswer: He revealed Joash to the rulers and made a covenant with them
questions.explanation: In the seventh year, Jehoiada revealed Joash to the leaders and established a covenant, aligning the political and spiritual authorities to God's plan (2 Kings 11:4). This coordination reflects God's sovereign orchestration of salvation history and covenant renewal (Exodus 19:5-6; Joshua 24:15; Psalm 89:3-4; Hebrews 8:6).

questions.question: How was the watch over the king's house organized on the Sabbath?
options: One third at the king's house, one third at the gate of Sur, one third at the gate behind the guard
Half at the temple, half at the palace
questions.correctAnswer: One third at the king's house, one third at the gate of Sur, one third at the gate behind the guard
questions.explanation: Jehoiada organized the watch so that a third guarded the king's house, a third the gate of Sur, and a third the gate behind the guard (2 Kings 11:5-6). This strategic protection highlights God's justice and order in governance (Nehemiah 4:13-14; 2 Chronicles 23:7; Psalm 127:1; Luke 12:35-36).

questions.question: What was the command regarding those who come within the ranges surrounding the king?
options: They should be arrested and judged
questions.correctAnswer: They should be slain
questions.explanation: Jehoiada commanded that anyone who comes within the ranges around the king should be slain (2 Kings 11:8), emphasizing the sanctity and protection of the God-ordained king. This reflects divine justice and protection over the anointed, paralleling Psalm 84:11, Exodus 22:28, and Acts 12:23.

questions.question: What items did Jehoiada give to the captains over the hundreds?
questions.correctAnswer: King David's spears and shields
questions.explanation: Jehoiada gave the captains King David's spears and shields stored in the temple, linking the legitimacy of Joash’s kingship to the Davidic covenant (2 Kings 11:10). This symbolizes God's covenant faithfulness and the continuity of messianic promise (2 Samuel 22:35; Psalm 18:34; Isaiah 11:4; Luke 1:32).

questions.question: Where was Joash crowned king and anointed?
options: In the house of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: In the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: Joash was crowned and anointed king in the house of the LORD (2 Kings 11:12), signifying divine approval and the sacred nature of kingship. This reflects the biblical pattern of anointing and divine ordination (1 Samuel 16:13; Psalm 2:6; 1 Kings 1:39; Acts 10:38).

questions.question: What was Athaliah’s reaction upon hearing the noise of the guard and the people?
options: She came to the temple and cried 'Treason!'
questions.correctAnswer: She came to the temple and cried 'Treason!'
questions.explanation: Athaliah came into the temple and cried 'Treason!' upon hearing the noise (2 Kings 11:13-14), showing her resistance to God's sovereign plan. Her reaction illustrates rebellion against true authority, echoing themes of human sinfulness and opposition to God’s purposes (Psalm 2:1-2; Isaiah 14:12-15; Romans 1:18-21; Revelation 17:16).

questions.question: What instruction did Jehoiada give regarding Athaliah’s removal?
options: She should be taken out of the temple and killed outside
She should be forgiven and exiled
She should be imprisoned in the temple
She should be crowned queen again
questions.correctAnswer: She should be taken out of the temple and killed outside
questions.explanation: Jehoiada commanded that Athaliah be taken out of the temple and killed outside, so she would not be slain in the house of the LORD (2 Kings 11:15). This respects the holiness of God's house and God's justice, consistent with Old Testament law (Exodus 22:28; Leviticus 19:30; 1 Kings 21:9-14; Hebrews 10:26-31).

questions.question: What covenant did Jehoiada establish after Joash was made king?
options: A covenant between the LORD, the king, and the people
A covenant with the priests only
A covenant to rebuild the temple
questions.correctAnswer: A covenant between the LORD, the king, and the people
questions.explanation: Jehoiada made a covenant between the LORD, the king, and the people, signifying a renewal of the theocratic relationship and God's kingdom rule (2 Kings 11:17). This covenant reflects biblical themes of divine-human relationship (Exodus 24:3-8; 1 Samuel 12:20; Jeremiah 31:33; Hebrews 8:10).

questions.question: What did the people do to the house of Baal after Joash was established king?
options: They broke down the altars and images and killed the priest of Baal
They rebuilt the altar of Baal
They offered sacrifices to both Baal and the LORD
They sealed the house of Baal
questions.correctAnswer: They broke down the altars and images and killed the priest of Baal
questions.explanation: After Joash’s installation, the people destroyed Baal’s altars and images and killed Mattan, the priest of Baal (2 Kings 11:18), demonstrating a zeal for exclusive worship of Yahweh. This reflects the biblical call for holiness and removal of idolatry (Exodus 20:3-5; Deuteronomy 12:2-4; Jeremiah 2:11-13; 1 Corinthians 10:14).

questions.question: How old was Jehoash when he began to reign as king?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven years old
questions.explanation: Jehoash was seven years old when he began to reign (2 Kings 11:21), indicating God's use of even the youngest to fulfill His purposes. This reflects God’s sovereign selection and empowerment, as with David (1 Samuel 16:12), Josiah (2 Chronicles 34:1), and Jesus’ early ministry (Luke 2:40).

questions.question: What does the preservation and anointing of Joash teach about God's providence?
options: God sovereignly preserves His covenant promises even in dire circumstances
God only acts through kings and priests
God allows evil to triumph without consequence
God's promises depend on human strength
questions.correctAnswer: God sovereignly preserves His covenant promises even in dire circumstances
questions.explanation: The hidden preservation and anointing of Joash reveal God's providence in maintaining His covenant line (2 Kings 11:2-12). This affirms God's faithfulness and sovereignty as seen in the lives of Joseph (Genesis 50:20), Daniel (Daniel 6), and ultimately Christ (Luke 1:32-33; Hebrews 13:5).

questions.question: How does Jehoiada's leadership reflect the role of the priesthood in Israel?
options: He acts as a mediator between God, king, and people, upholding covenant faithfulness
He seizes political power for himself
He ignores the king and focuses only on rituals
questions.correctAnswer: He acts as a mediator between God, king, and people, upholding covenant faithfulness
questions.explanation: Jehoiada's role in orchestrating the restoration of the king and covenant shows the priest as mediator and covenant guardian (2 Kings 11:4,17). This typifies the priestly function seen in Exodus 19:6, Leviticus 10:11, and ultimately Christ as the Great High Priest (Hebrews 4:14-16; 7:23-28).
